“Are you reading for the law, Rodion Romanovitch?”  
“Yes, I was…”  
“Then consider this. If I suspect someone is a criminal, why worry him prematurely? Some cases require immediate action, but others don’t. Why not let him walk about?”  
Raskolnikov’s lips compressed. His eyes burned into Porfiry Petro-vitch.  
“Evidence can be taken two ways,” Porfiry continued. “I want proof as clear as two plus two.”  
Raskolnikov remained silent, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The speaker discusses the complexities of handling criminal suspects and the nuances of evidence in legal proceedings.
